Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a tying home run in the third inning and a tying double in the fifth.
Cards avoided Chourio winning with an intentional walk in the 10th inning.
Game went into 11th and 12th innings with Cardinals scoring in both.
Close play in 11th inning where a catch seemed possible but the ball popped out for an RBI double.
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers had a 0-for-21 skid in the previous game and 1-for-22 skid in this game.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy expressed frustration with the team's mental toughness and bullpen performance.
Murphy praised Chourio's clutch performance but was critical of the team's focus.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brewers' offense was quiet, and the bullpen struggled, allowing Cardinals to take advantage.
Brewers' starter Aaron Civale allowed two runs in the first inning but held Cardinals to three runs over five innings.
